<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Lazy re-exports are similar to normal re-exports, except that for callable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// symbols the definitions are replaced with trampolines that will look up and</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// enable lazy compilation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Manages a set of &#39;lazy call-through&#39; trampolines. These are compiler</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// re-entry trampolines that are pre-bound to look up a given symbol in a given</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// JITDylib, then jump to that address. Since compilation of symbols is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// triggered on first lookup, these call-through trampolines can be used to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// implement lazy compilation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The easiest way to construct these call-throughs is using the lazyReexport</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function.</span></CodeLine>
